title: Spaghetti Carbonara
summary: A classic Italian pasta dish with eggs, cheese, bacon, and black pepper.
instructions: Cook spaghetti.Fry bacon.Mix eggs and cheese.Combine everything

title: Chicken Tikka Masala
summary: Chunks of grilled chicken (tikka) cooked in a smooth buttery & creamy tomato based gravy.
instructions: Marinate chicken.Grill chicken.Cook tomatoes and spices.Add cream and mix

title: Vegetable Stir Fry
summary: Quick and healthy vegetable stir fry with soy sauce and garlic.
instructions: Chop vegetables.Stir-fry with garlic.Add soy sauce.Serve hot

title: Beef Stroganoff
summary: Tender beef in a creamy mushroom sauce, served with noodles or rice.
instructions: Cook beef.Saute mushrooms & onions.Add sour cream.Serve over noodles

title: Lemon Garlic Shrimp Pasta
summary: Garlic butter shrimp tossed in pasta with a hint of lemon.
instructions: Cook pasta.Saute shrimp with garlic.Toss with pasta and lemon juice

title: Caprese Salad
summary: Simple Italian salad with tomatoes, mozzarella, and basil.
instructions: Slice tomatoes and mozzarella.Arrange with basil.Drizzle with olive oil

title: Miso Soup
summary: Traditional Japanese soup with miso paste, tofu, and seaweed.
instructions: Heat dashi.Add miso paste.Stir in tofu and seaweed.Serve warm

title: Greek Gyros
summary: Savory Greek-style meat served in pita bread with tzatziki sauce.
instructions: Cook lamb.Prepare tzatziki.Assemble in pita bread.Serve with veggies

title: Mango Smoothie
summary: Refreshing mango smoothie blended with yogurt and honey.
instructions: Blend all ingredients.Serve chilled

title: Chocolate Brownies
summary: Rich and fudgy chocolate brownies with a crisp top layer.
instructions: Mix ingredients.Bake at 350°F.Let cool.Serve

title: Jollof Rice
summary: A popular West African dish made with rice, tomatoes, and spices.
instructions: Saute onions and peppers. Add blended tomatoes and cook. Add spices and rice. Simmer until done

title: Nyama Choma
summary: Kenyan-style grilled meat, usually beef or goat, served with kachumbari.
instructions: Marinate meat. Grill over charcoal. Serve with kachumbari salad

title: Bobotie
summary: A South African baked spiced minced meat dish topped with an egg-based custard.
instructions: Soak bread in milk. Fry onions and curry powder. Add minced beef and cook. Top with custard and bake

title: Egusi Soup
summary: A Nigerian soup made with ground melon seeds and vegetables.
instructions: Blend egusi seeds. Fry in palm oil. Add meat and stock. Simmer with vegetables

title: Injera with Doro Wat
summary: Ethiopian sourdough flatbread served with spicy chicken stew.
instructions: Ferment teff batter. Cook injera on a hot pan. Simmer chicken with berbere spice and onions

title: Kapenta with Sadza
summary: A Zimbabwean dish of small dried fish served with maize porridge.
instructions: Fry kapenta with tomatoes and onions. Cook maize meal into sadza. Serve together

title: Bunny Chow
summary: A South African street food dish of curry served in a hollowed-out bread loaf
instructions: Cook chicken curry with spices. Hollow out bread. Fill with curry

title: Matoke
summary: A Ugandan dish of cooked plantains, mashed with spices.
instructions: Peel and chop plantains. Cook with onions and tomatoes. Mash and serve

title: Thieboudienne
summary: A Senegalese one-pot dish of rice, fish, and vegetables.
instructions: Fry fish. Cook vegetables and tomatoes. Add rice and simmer until done

title: Chakalaka
summary: A South African spicy vegetable relish served with bread or pap.
instructions: Grate carrots. Fry onions and chili. Add tomatoes and beans. Simmer and serve

title: Ugali with Sukuma Wiki
summary: A staple Kenyan meal of maize flour porridge served with sautéed collard greens
instructions: Boil water. Add maize flour gradually while stirring. Cook until thick. Sauté collard greens with onions and salt. Serve together

title: Pilau
summary: A fragrant Swahili rice dish cooked with meat, spices, and broth.
instructions: Fry onions, garlic, and spices. Add beef and cook. Add rice and broth. Simmer until rice is tender

title: Githeri
summary: A nutritious one-pot dish of boiled maize and beans, often enjoyed as a main meal.
instructions: Boil maize and beans until tender. Sauté onions and tomatoes. Mix with the boiled maize and beans. Serve hot

title: Mutura
summary: Kenyan-style grilled sausage made from minced meat and spices, stuffed into an intestine casing.
instructions: Clean intestines. Mix minced meat with spices. Stuff meat mixture into intestines. Boil, then grill until crispy
